goal.ch:
This course, “Technical English Writing, Communication, and Oral Presentation,“ is designed to equip students with essential skills for effective technical communication in both professional and academic settings. Over 16 weeks, students will develop proficiency in writing clear and concise technical documents, delivering impactful oral presentations, and engaging in professional communication within technical teams.

The course employs a project-based learning approach. Given the integral relationship between technology, humanity, and the world, our goal is to clearly present the use, function, and contributions of technological design and its impact on society. Students will learn how to write, express, and communicate effectively. By the end of the semester, students will present their chosen projects through film presentations.

outline.ch:
This course will be both enjoyable and practical. Various resources and modalities will be employed to assist you in improving your English for Specific Purposes.
Key Components of the Course:
1. Technical Writing:
1.1 Fundamentals of Technical Writing: Learn the principles of clarity, conciseness, and coherence in writing. Understand the importance of audience and purpose.
Technical Documents: Master the structure and components of technical reports, articles, manuals, and proposals. Gain experience in writing abstracts, introductions, methodologies, results, and conclusions.
1.2 Advanced Writing Techniques: Develop a personal writing style, enhance editing and proofreading skills, and learn to create effective visual aids like diagrams, tables, and charts.
2. Technical Communication:
2.1 Communication Principles: Understand the principles of effective technical communication, including audience analysis, message clarity, and the use of appropriate jargon.
2.2 Professional Communication: Learn to write professional emails, memos, and reports. Engage in role-playing activities to simulate technical meetings and team collaborations.
2.3 Ethical and Cross-Cultural Communication: Explore ethical considerations and cultural differences in technical communication, enhancing your ability to communicate in diverse and global contexts.
3. Oral Presentation:
3.1 Planning and Structuring Presentations:
Develop skills in planning and structuring technical presentations with a clear message and logical flow. Learn to design effective slides and visual aids.
3.2 Delivery Techniques:
Master techniques for effective oral delivery, including voice modulation, body language, and audience engagement. Practice handling questions and feedback during presentations.
3.3 Presentation Practice: Gain hands-on experience through student presentations, peer reviews, and constructive feedback sessions.
**More detailed information about the syllabus will be available on the ee-class platform.
** AI tools will be embedded in the classes to support self-learning.
